meta.description:
With the slew of machine learning and AI implementations to monitor behavior and find patterns in everything, the field of personalization has never been more fertile - and people will embrace it.
The crucial factor here is to find the right balance between customer data and driving convenience - customer loyalty will reside in the entity that can meet that one consumer's demands to a T.

While the sharing economy was mostly accelerated in mobility and real estate rental, its consequences are being felt universally. This is one of the big drivers in the rise of platform organizations.
The regular user is - of course - relatively agnostic to how a service operates. The consensual shift to platforms supported by sharing economy models is explained by the sheer scalability and seamlessness that are now within reach.
To businesses operating with their core parallel to these players, it is urgent that they form partnerships, because the advantages in speed, efficiency and ease of maintenance/cost to run seem unrivalled and piling up.

Part of a greater whole, transparency has never been as present in people's minds as today. Besides paying attention to the supply chain footprint of the food we buy, society is increasingly privileging options in every field that operate in a glassdoor manner. Clothes coming from Southeast Asia resonate with humans rights violations. Users are glad to know that Apple is promising to use 100% recycled Aluminum and stride to recycle 100% in their own and (already billions) other iPhones sold.

Technology adoption among is universally attributed to Millenials and younger generations. This is partly true, but leads to a gross underestimation of tech use in older generations. Especially older urban dwellers are more than happy to adopt smart locks for safety, kitchen assistants for convenient cooking and uber to stop waiting for a taxi while it's raining.
This proves to be a greatly misrepresented segment that embodies a great business oportunity, if only companies start planning around it (remember older generations also have greater purchasing power).

Consumers are very aware of the impact of their purchases. Thus they want to make sure that the footprint of the products they take home is as socially and environmentally sustainable as possible. Retailers must be able to keep track of each step of the product's life cycle.
It's not just black and white anymore. The duality vegetarians/meat lovers is becoming every day more obsolete as more people start to reduce the amount of meat they consume.

Without touching the discussion topic to what caused this movement, it is unquestionably that there is a fast-rising concern for how "gut-friendly" the food we buy really is. Fashionable expressions such as pro or prebiotics are dealbreakers in the daily choices made by a growingly significant segment of society. To the unaware, the myriad of intolerances we hear about seems to have sprung from nowhere, but it certainly drove an unforeseen demand for the likes of tempeh, kefir, kimchi, flaxseed, and anything else that helps the consumer to steer clear from the wide selection of ingredients they've found harmful (think gluten, sat, unsat or trans fat, lactose, etc...).

Total foreign residency in Portugal has been steadily rising for a few years, to a point where a significant demographic segment has different primary languages and cultures. If the current political climate remains relatively stable, this is only expected to accelerate.
With today's advances in personalization, behavior analysis and related tools, great oportunities lie in adjusting supply to a changing customer base.

Due to a variety of different factors, tourism today is more widespread than ever, and its prevalence increases by the year. This is true not only for net volume of travellers, but also variety of destinations and especially origins. As our world is experiencing the longest period of global peace in human history, and technology allows us to be a plane ride away from nearly every inch of land in our globe, nearly every culture is venturing outside its home.
Socio-economic progress, of course, closely follows tourism development.
The UNWTO estimates the business volume of tourism globally to equal or exceed that of oil exports, automobiles or food products. It is no wonder then, that this trend embodies a great deal of opportunities for businesses to cash-in on travellers who are more than willing to spend an extra coin to improve the experience they are keen to live.

According to BBC, 400 million tons of plastic is produced every year with 40% of its applications being thrown out after the first use. Plastic is not biodegradable, which means it will stay around for hundreds of years – representing a big threat for the environment. 
The debate on reducing plastic production is gathering more followers every day and people expect retailers to be a part of the process to save the world. Sustainable materials for packaging and bulk food are some of the solutions that customers value and are willing to pay extra to get.

Consumers are shifting their attention from TV to Youtube, Facebook and Instagram. Social media influencers are the new epicenter of new lifestyles, behaviors and social trends. This represents an opportunity for retailers to promote their products in a more decentralized (and effective) way. Companies who provide digital sharable products and experiences increase their reach with continuously growing scalability.

There's a clear shift from function to experience: consumers buy goods that address their needs but they also want to experience something else (see the applications Educational Retail or Insta Worthiness in this Radar). But people are also more informed than ever: our ability to understand the specific things that are good for us is continually growing. Thus, brands should be able to clearly communicate the value proposition of their products and the instant benefit of their consumption.
With enough creativity, our favorite indulgences can become a part of a healthy lifestyle. Cauliflower-based pizza? Yes, please!

A single family will probably have numerous diet restrictions: grandma is lactose intolerant, the father is gluten--free and the older daughter is trying a vegan regimen. The criteria of this family’s shopping list is almost impossible to meet – and that’s why they’ll prefer the retailer who provides them a customized service that addresses all their needs. By reducing the amount of plastic needed for packaging, bulk food is a win-win situation to the customer, the retailer, and the planet.

Too much choice can be as harmful as no choice at all: just think of the time you spend trying to choose what to watch on Netflix. AI and Data mining are helping customers making some sense of the chaos with shopping list recommendations or customized campaigns.
For the keen-eyed manager, there are many unexplored opportunities to address in helping those customers who couldn't care less if they go for the 3-ply perfumed compact or the 4-ply extra-comfort toilet paper.

The number of people with particular diets is increasing and food retailers must adapt. People want a customized service for every situation (e.g. 2 people in a couple buying 2 different meals and still eating together)
The fight against animal cruelty keeps gathering new supporters and some paradigms such as bullfighting and slaughterhouses may have their days counted.

One of the strategies on the war on plastic is to rethink packages, either in size or material composition. Reducing size to what is strictly necessary and creating materials that are easier to recycle (usually opting in for monomaterials) are strategies that should be adopted by both designers and suppliers.

partner.name: MonoSol
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: MonoSol is engineered to create individual pouches, sachets, or delivery systems that disappear and release their contents when exposed to hot or cold liquids.

partner.name: Wikicells
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Wikicells enclose food and drink inside soft skins that are entirely comprised of natural food particles held together by nutritive ions, and generally protects the soft skins with hard shells that are either completely edible (like an orange peel) or varied biodegradable (like the shell of a coconut.)

partner.name: EcoSol®
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: EcoSol® is a water soluble, biodegradable, polyvinyl alcohol (PVOH) film ideally suited for various packaging applications. Water soluble PVOH bags, sachets, or pouches created from this unique, technically advanced film provide a convenient, safe, and economical delivery system for a wide range of products.

partner.name: Solubags
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: PVOH (Polyvinyl alcohol) is a synthetic polymer that degrades when is in contact with water and do not contaminate. It can be used to do plastic bags or other packaging. This hydro soluble material has no odor and is not toxic, and is resistant to grease, oils, and solvents. PVOH is ductile but strong, flexible, and functions as a high oxygen and aroma barrier.

partner.name: dropwater
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Drop Water is reinventing how bottled water is made and distributed. Our kiosks bottle drinks at the point of purchase in 100% compostable bottles.

partner.name: Bulkbox Foods
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Fill your kitchen with beautiful meals starting at $2.90, while knowing you are getting the quality and value of farm to market food that your family deserves.

technology.name: Edible or water soluble films for Food packaging
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Food packed in edible packaging to deliver optimum dosing, customer convenience and sustainability. Edible or water-soluble plastic film is made from the milk protein casein which guards food against oxygen, and provide more sustainable products. Transparent, odorless and tasteless pre-portioned packets streamline food and beverage manufacturing, reducing cross-contamination and dusting in kitchen or manufacturing applications. Deliver ingredients such as various food coloring, spices and oils in food-grade water-soluble film.
technology.prevwork: A study was started in the end of 2018 to explore the possibility of using this material in bags for groceries or dry products sold in bulk (e.g. fruits and vegetables).

technology.name: Bio-plastics
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Bio-materials provide special characteristics to plastics. Innovative advanced materials are continuously in development. Those materials are derived from renewable biomass sources, such as vegetable fats and oils, corn starch, or microbiota. Most of bioplastics are biodegradable, which that under the right conditions the microbes in the environment can break down the material and use it as a food source.
technology.prevwork: A study is available with a list of technologies that can be used. Further study about the most disruptive technologies is still missing.

implementation.name: evian 100% Recycled Plastic Bottles
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Danone, Evian’s parent company, has announced that the famous mineral water from the Alps will only come in 100 percent recycled bottles in a few years, championing packaging circularity as a way of reducing plastic waste.

meta.description: Lives are changing, with easy access to different lifestyles people may not be dedicated to traditional activities anymore. This means that tasks like buying raw and cooking may be replaced for ordering in, having take-away food or eating out. By transforming supermarkets into food preparation locations we are creating an in-between of restaurants and home-cooking.

implementation.name: Avec Box and Avec X
implementation.author: nlg
implementation.description: At 10.00 a.m. on 6 April 2019, Valora's first cashier-free convenience stores will open their doors with avec box and the avec X future store at Zurich main station. Access, purchase and payment are controlled by the avec app. In the new stores, convenience refers not only to the product range, but the entire shopping experience which can be done even more comfortably, at your own pace and outside of normal opening hours.

implementation.name: Shopping At Hema With Locals: Here's What 'New Retail' Was Really Like
implementation.author: man
implementation.description: With online platforms for all kinds of products, a trip to the store may become redundant. This is why stores need to become experiential spaces and answer to a new set of needs and wishes; Hema is a great example of a merge between a supermarket and a restaurant, aided by technology.

implementation.name: Jungle. All the flavor, none of the Chemicals.
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: The company provides a unique plant production technology and a full software solution supported by an operational services package securing its clients a consistent supply of clean, nutrient rich and tasty plants.

partner.name: Nelson and Pade
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Aquaponic Systems® produce higher quality fish and vegetables with increased production over other systems. The water flowing through the system is nutrient-rich, but clear, providing bio-security and food safety. The plant roots are bright white and clean and the fish are raised in fresh, clear water.

partner.name: Infarm
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Farms inspired by nature’s most elegant design and structures. Each is its own ecosystem that tailor light spectrums, temperature, and nutrients to ensure the maximum natural expression of each plant.

partner.name: Koalo
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Koalo create ecosystems to grow organic food indoors. Koaloponics combines leading-edge aquaponics research with web-connected tags, sensors and controls to create a smart indoor growing system.

partner.name: Grow to green
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Plants are grown in a multilayer indoor environment where temperature, humidity, CO2 concentration, lighting conditions and plant nutrition (via a hydroponics system) are not only monitored but also carefully controlled. With this technology, climatic or biological risks are virtually eliminated from normal plant development so you can grow better vegetables all year round.

partner.name: Pentair Aquatic Eco-System
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Shortages of water and energy. Urban food deserts. Pollution of soils and waterways. There’s a clear need for sustainable new sources of nutritious food. Aquaponics is the future. Pentair Aquatic Eco-Systems is committed to the commercialization of systems that create the better water needed to grow healthy fish and plants.

partner.name: Ogarden
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Compact and fully automated, the OGarden allows you to grow up to 90 vegetables at the same time throughout the year. Growing your vegetables will be a pleasure with the OGarden Smart, an independent vegetable garden designed for your living room.

technology.name: Hydroponics for In-store greenhouse
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: In-store hydroponics to deliver the freshest products. Plants grow in a water-based environment where the right nutrients in the right amount are distributed through capillary action, without using of soil.
technology.prevwork: A Study is available. An experiement was planned but it was canceled for lack of suitable partners for the envisaged use case.

technology.name: Aquaponics for In-store greenhouse
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: In-store production of greens and fish in a symbiotic environment. Fish share the water tank with bacteria that turn their waste into a rich fertilizer that is then fed to the plants.

meta.description: Impatiance is growing as consumers keep getting bombed by increasingly amounts of information. Brands have now the responsability to ease that pain by clearly communicating the value proposition of their products in a simple and balanced way.

implementation.name: H&M's insignia for customers with high demands but little time
implementation.author: nlg
implementation.description: The concept of long-lasting design has been at the core of ARKET since we began developing our first collection. We put effort into sourcing durable and sustainable materials, and we collaborate with skillful suppliers around the world to create high-quality products that can be used and loved for a long time.

implementation.name: Brandless
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Brandless creates high-quality stuff at an incredible value. Get everything you need for the whole family and give back at the same time. Shop & save today.

implementation.name: Plain English Campaign
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Since 1979, we have been campaigning against gobbledygook, jargon and misleading public information. We have helped many government departments and other official organisations with their documents, reports and publications. We believe that everyone should have access to clear and concise information.

partner.name: Estimote
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Estimote SDK can be embedded into mobile apps, which can then use signals from built-in sensors or nearby beacons to estimate the context and micro-location of an event. Developers can easily build proximity or indoor location applications and trigger pre-programmed actions or send relevant messages.

partner.name: Kontakt
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Kontakt.io is digitalizing the physical world. Bluetooth beacons and infrastructure management tools help businesses build context-rich applications to improve customer experience.

partner.name: Keep Warranty
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Keep Warranty is an app that saves your purchase slips and warranties, reminding you when they’re about to expire. You can store your warranties by category, making it easier to organize and find them.

partner.name: oko
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Intelligent Newsroom Assistant

partner.name: nevis
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: nevisQ - The intelligent baseboards for the discreet surveillance of rooms.

partner.name: situm
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Situm is present in thousands of buildings from different industries worldwide, from hospitals, airports and train stations to museums, corporate buildings and factories, providing the most precise indoor positioning with the minimal infrastructure

technology.name: Indoor positioning
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Retailers can precisely locate customers and provide them an improved experience. Technology such as Li-Fi, Beacons, ultrasounds, Wi-Fi, dead reckoning and others, are used to create indoor positioning systems. These systems allow retailers to locate customers and allow customers to navigate in-store and easily find items. An indoor positioning system is also essential for autonomous robots to navigate in-store.
technology.prevwork: A study is available. An experiment is being conducted by Innovation department in collaboration with Digital department.

meta.description: In a world that cannot support the current consumption of protein sources, alternatives are being developed to deliver the same taste, structure or nutritional value of what it intents to replace.

implementation.name: Plant-Based Protein Comes To Burger King: Meet The Impossible Whopper
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Having it your way at Burger King could now mean ordering a plant-based patty that bleeds. The fast-food chain with $21 billion in systemwide sales is testing its own Impossible Whopper.

implementation.name: Carrefour Bugs
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Carrefour has begun, in Spain, to market a new range of foods made with insects, as announced by the distribution group on Tuesday.

implementation.name: Unilever & The Vegetarian Butcher
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Food and personal care multinational Unilever is acquiring Netherlands-based The Vegetarian Butcher.

implementation.name: Shrimp made from algae
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Shrimp, United States’ most popular seafood, is notorious for being farmed using practices that destroy the environment. New Wave Foods, a startup based in San Francisco, has set out to create a sustainable replacement.

implementation.name: McDonald's McVeggie
implementation.author: nlg
implementation.description: Official site of McDonald's Portugal. Find the news and our menu, job offers and all the information on quality, nutrition and the Ronald McDonald Children's Foundation.

implementation.name: Vegan burgers: now juicy, pink and bloody
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Supermarkets stock up as millions of UK ‘flexitarians’ boost demand for fake meat

implementation.name: Tesco selling vegetable meat
implementation.author: nlg
implementation.description: The Beyond Burger, the plant-based bleeding burger made with pea protein, is now available in the UK in Tesco stores.

partner.name: Follow your Heart - VeganEgg
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: A 100% plant-based egg, no GMO, no dairy, no gluten, no cholesterol.

partner.name: Impossible foods
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: A vegetarian burger that looks just like meat because it contains heme which contains iron which, when exposed to oxygen, turns red, just like blood, and also creates those meat flavors. Heme is a protein that can both be found in blood and in the roots of some Leguminosae which are nitrogen-fixing plants such as soy and alfalfa.

partner.name: AHIMI
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Ahimi™ is a healthy, safe, raw Ahi without the tuna. Made from tomatoes and a few simple ingredients, this clean cuisine offers all the taste without harming our oceans. Tomatoes contain high levels of naturally-occurring glutamic acids, which are responsible for the savory flavor of meaty foods.

partner.name: Perfect Day
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Based in Berkeley, California, Perfect Day is a startup that uses cellular agriculture to produce animal-free dairy proteins. By designing yeast to produce the same dairy proteins found in milk from a cow, Perfect Day can make the same milk. Without needing the cow.

partner.name: The Not Company
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Based on artificial intelligence, it looks for food formulas recurring only to vegetable sources, trying to mimic either the flavor or the texture of the original mayo.

partner.name: Beyond burger
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Beyond Meat® products are 100% plant protein. Beyond Beef is 100% pea protein and Beyond Chicken is a blend of soy and pea protein.  The Beyond Burger looks, cooks, and tastes like a fresh beef burger.

partner.name: Field Roast’s Chao Creamery
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Chao is a culinary tradition of fermenting tofu popular throughout Asia. Touted as the “cheese” of Asia, it can now easily be purchased in Asian grocery stores throughout North America and Europe. It looks much like marinated feta, as it is sold brined in a small jar, and has the mouthfeel of something like blue cheese.

partner.name: Bugsolutely
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Cricket pasta (20% bug, 80% flour). Crickets are actually very similar anatomically to shrimps, and they have fantastic food properties.

partner.name: SuperMeat
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Cultured meat is made from animal cells, without the use of the animals themselves. The final outcome is an all-purpose meat. The production of cultured meat begins by incubating cells in a media that is rich in nutrients. Those nutrients help the cells thrive and divide. It is biologically the same as the meat that comes from animals. Our products will be non-GMO and with no animal products besides the original cells.

partner.name: Daiya
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Daiya makes dairy-free food products. From grilled cheese to the rich and creamy taste of fruit-kissed yogurt. Every Daiya product — from macaroni and cheese to Greek yogurt alternative — is a plant-based, dairy-free alternative disguised as creamy, cheesy deliciousness right there on your plate. They are ready for lactose intolerant people, food allergies free, vegan and vegetarian.

partner.name: Aquafaba
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Egg’s white is replaced by the water that surrounds either chickpeas or white beans.

partner.name: EntoCube
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: EntoCube currently has the ability to produce controlled atmosphere shipping containers of various sizes that can be manually operated to farm food-grade insects.

partner.name: Gardein - Golden Fishless Filet
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Gardein™ claim to help the world eat less meat. That's why we make delicious meatless chick'n tenders, meatless meatballs, and more. Now you can skip meat for a meal, or a month, without skipping your favorite foods.

partner.name: Gold&Green Foods
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Gold&Green Foods calls their version "pulled oats" since it is made from oats and broad beans from Finland and Sweden. The product is created by having the oats "sheared and heated under the right conditions and combined with the beans," and the flavor options include nude, kaffir lime with sesame and ginger, and tomato with smoked pepper and cilantro.

partner.name: Ripple Original
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Ripple Original trade in thin, chalky nut milks for a plant-based alternative that’s actually rich, creamy and satisfying, with 8 times more protein than milk. Ripple Original is gentle on your body and the planet - 100% dairy-free, vegan, nut, lactose and gluten-free. Each serving has 8g of protein, 50% more calcium than 2% dairy milk, more Vitamin D and Iron and contains only ½ the sugar of 2% dairy milk.

partner.name: Memphis Meats
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: The company's process includes isolating small amounts of animal cells that are able to regenerate, and providing them with oxygen and nutrients, with fetal bovine serum used in order to initiate the entire process. The cells can then be harvested anywhere between nine to 21 days. The process uses 90% less water and land, and 50% less energy compared to conventional agriculture.

partner.name: Vbites
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: The only truly sustainably sourced salmon. Our plant-based salmon alternative can be used for a variety of foodstuffs. Create canapes as a party food. Try a few slices in a bagel with a vegan cream cheese. Throw strips into a scrambled tofu. How you use this fantastic food is up to your imagination, but it’s always guaranteed to be delicious.

partner.name: Follow your Heart - Vegenaise
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: This breakthrough formula gives you a creamy and authentic cheese flavor dairy free and cholesterol free. This alternative is lactose free, soy free, gluten free, Non-GMO Project verified and contains no preservatives or trans fats.

partner.name: Vegan Cheese
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Through synthetic biology yeasts are engineered to become milk-protein factories. Milk proteins are then combined with water and vegan oil to make vegan milk which is ultimately converted into vegan cheese.

partner.name: Syngja
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: BUGS'N SHOT - a series of delicious juice shots with 1% cricket that boost your natural energy in everyday life. Because we are ready to embark on a new chapter of exciting food products that contribute to the personal health, promote vitality & challenge the norms.

partner.name: Wholi
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Our vision is to create a more sustainable and globally responsible food culture through delicious and healthy foods with bugs.

partner.name: Good Karma Flaxmilk
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Bring on the playground smiles! Pack your kiddos’ lunchbox with a delicious and nutritious treat full of plant-based protein, Omega-3s and a touch of sweetness.

partner.name: NOVAMEAT
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Plant-Based Meat, Reinvented.

partner.name: Portugal Bugs
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Portugal Bugs aims to contribute to the future of human food by creating food products with insect incorporation thus contributing to an alternative, highly nutritious and sustainable source of protein.

partner.name: Algama
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Algama creates the next-generation daily food product that harnesses the unique potential of microalgae with a tasty spoonful of joy: good for people and sustainable.

partner.name: Quorn Foods
partner.author: aec
partner.description: Enjoy healthy, low fat vegetarian versions of your favorite recipes. Browse products & learn about our mission to produce healthy protein for a healthy planet.

partner.name: kriket
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: KRIKET is a delicious snack. An irresistible mix of nuts, grains, seeds and crickets, and 100% sourced in Brussels.

partner.name: Sens
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: The most innovative bars with crickets, the new superfood. Pure ingredients only, no added sugar, gluten free and delicious.

partner.name: Seamore
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: We believe we have found something that will change the way we think of food. Upgrade your food with I sea bacon and I sea pasta.

technology.name: Vegetable protein isolation for Egg substitutes
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Eggs can have a substitute themselves or be used for its broad features. A lot of products and recipes use eggs, and therefore there is a need to replace egg’s binding function, texture addition, or nutrient enrichment with vegetable sources.

technology.name: Vegetable protein isolation for Meat substitutes
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Have vegetable-based products with the same nutrients set and taste as meat or fish. Soy protein is globular while actual meat protein is fibrous, so food manufacturers alter the soy's molecular structure. This is typically done by exposing the soy protein to heat, acid or a solvent and then running the mixture through a food extruder that reshapes it. But soy isn't the only way to create meat-like products.
technology.prevwork: A internal project, Food Lab, is exploring readymade alternatives for hamburgers with Food Private Labels and H&W department.

technology.name: Non-animal protein isolation for Milk free dairy
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Have vegetable or yeast-based products with the same taste and nutrients set as animal based dairy products. The dairy industry is responsible for thousands of products, replacing milk is done recurring to vegetable sources and treating them to resemble the originals in either shape, texture, cooking behavior or flavor. Most dairy-free substitutes are made with yeast, soy protein, textured vegetable protein (TVP) or nuts oils

technology.name: Insects for New foods
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: New foods are being developed to respond to consumer demand. Edible insects contain high quality protein, vitamins and amino acids for humans. Insects have a high food conversion rate, needing less feed than animals to produce the same amount of protein.
technology.prevwork: An internal project, Food Lab, is exploring readymade alternatives for pasta and snacks with Food Private Labels and H&W department. DGAV denied to the request to commercialize insects.An internal project, Food Lab, is exploring readymade alternatives for pasta and snacks with Food Private Labels and H&W department. DGAV denied to the request to commercialize human food with insects. Further lobby must be done to go further with this project.

technology.name: Cell growth for Meat substitutes
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Products made of muscle cells that never been inside of an animal - same taste, nutrient and texture as meat. It is a form of cellular agriculture. Cultured meat is produced using many of the same tissue engineering techniques traditionally used in regenerative medicine. Through this technique muscle tissue is produced, having this way cultured meat.

meta.description: Newer generations understand that in order to have a future livable world, some changes in lifestyle have to be made, like reducing the consumption of meat to a more sustainable and healthy intake.

implementation.name: Flexitarianism: Meatless Mondays
implementation.author: man
implementation.description: Meat Free Monday highlights how going without meat for at least one day a week can make a huge difference to the planet, health and even our pockets. With high profile chefs now embracing and celebrating vegetables, “flexitarianism” on the rise.

implementation.name: Tesco Wicked Kitchen
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: Wicked Kitchen is a new, bold and innovative way for you to experience the power of mighty plant flavors unleashed. Wicked Kitchen is a radical new concept developed by pioneering chef Derek Sarno, in collaboration with Tesco. It's about putting plant-based food front and center in a creative and amazing way.

implementation.name: Crussh Fully Vegan Store for Veganuary
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: Health, Fitness, Fit Food, Raw Juice, Juice, Delivery, Protein, Vegan, Food, London, Cafe, Health Food, Healthy

implementation.name: Marks and Spencer Plant Kitchen
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: Shop the latest trends in Plant Kitchen at M&S.  Order online for home delivery or free collection from your nearest store.

partner.name: Carrots
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Some restaurants are better than others at offering interesting, tasty veggie options. We’ve analyzed and rated hundreds of them - so now you can easily find a restaurant with something meat-free on their menu that’s right up your street.

meta.description: Develop single dose products in all ranges in food, hygiene and home care. Packaging must be innovative to provide economic and environmental sustainability.

implementation.name: OoHo
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: Ooho is a spherical flexible packaging can also be used for other liquids including water, soft drinks, spirits and cosmetics, and our proprietary material is actually cheaper than plastic. A compound made from brown algae and calcium chloride creates a gel around the water. While the package is being formed, the water is frozen as ice, making it possible to create a bigger sphere and keeping the ingredients in the membrane and out of the water

implementation.name: Bel cheeses snack
implementation.author: man
implementation.description: Bel Brands is at it again with two new cheese snacks that are "grate"™ as a mid-afternoon energy boost or as a lunchbox.

partner.name: Chill Can
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Chill-Can has a built-in heat exchange unit which contains the technology necessary to chill the drink in under a minute. Upon activation (pressing the button), the patented technology activates the environmentally safe reclaimed Co2 in the HEU that leads to the chilling of the beverage.

partner.name: HeatGenie / HeatGen
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: HeatGenie is a self-heating package that used solid-fuel technology within a modular heat source. After pushing the button, the product heats a coffee or soup in 2 minutes.

partner.name: MonoSol
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: MonoSol is engineered to create individual pouches, sachets, or delivery systems that disappear and release their contents when exposed to hot or cold liquids.

partner.name: Wikicells
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Wikicells enclose food and drink inside soft skins that are entirely comprised of natural food particles held together by nutritive ions, and generally protects the soft skins with hard shells that are either completely edible (like an orange peel) or varied biodegradable (like the shell of a coconut.)

technology.name: Smart materials for Self-cooling packaging
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Active packaging with the ability to cool down food contents without external power sources. Cooling is achieved by an endothermic reaction that the user initiates by pressing on the bottom of the can.  A container for the beverage surrounds a container of the cooling agent separated from a container of water by a thin breakable membrane. The resulting reaction consumes heat and thus colds the product surrounding it.
technology.prevwork: A study is available. We are currently looking for a viable partner to run a proof-of-concept

technology.name: Edible or water soluble films for Food packaging
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Food packed in edible packaging to deliver optimum dosing, customer convenience and sustainability. Edible or water-soluble plastic film is made from the milk protein casein which guards food against oxygen, and provide more sustainable products. Transparent, odorless and tasteless pre-portioned packets streamline food and beverage manufacturing, reducing cross-contamination and dusting in kitchen or manufacturing applications. Deliver ingredients such as various food coloring, spices and oils in food-grade water-soluble film.
technology.prevwork: A study was started in the end of 2018 to explore the possibility of using this material in bags for groceries or dry products sold in bulk (e.g. fruits and vegetables).

technology.name: Smart materials for Self-heating packaging
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Ready to eat food can deliver additional convenience if the package can heat the food. The source of the heat for the self-heated packaging is an exothermic reaction initiated by the user. A container for the beverage surrounds a container of the heating agent separated from a container of water by a thin breakable membrane.
technology.prevwork: A study is available. We are currently looking for a viable partner to run a proof-of-concept

meta.description: While many consumers are actively making the choice to reduce or avoid certain foods (think anything dairy, gluten, eggs, meat…), a significant lot would happily resume their intake if they could. This represents a great part of the appeal in pro+prebiotics, where you healthily repopulate the gut microbiome and feed it as well, to hopefully lead a non-eventful gut-routine and maybe even ease or eliminate some of your intolerances and sensitivities.

implementation.name: Kelloggs Hi Happy Inside
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: Give your insides what they need with this new, delicious cereal brought to you by the W.K. Kellogg Institute.

partner.name: A2 Milk
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: A2 milk is cow's milk that mostly lacks a form of β-casein proteins called A1 and instead has mostly the A2 form which many believe causes the same gut problems as lactose intolerance. The Australian A2 Milk Company claims that this milk is a result of breeding, not GMOs, brought this product to the market and has 10% of milk market share in Australia.

partner.name: Cuisine Soleil
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Cuisine Soleil found success on foreign markets with its grilled lentils healthy snacks, sold everywhere in Canada but also in France and Mexico. Since 2017, started a metamorphosis. It set up an agri-food facility in Val-d'Or (Québec), where it now develops new innovating products such as gluten-free flour made of millet, coconut or buckwheat. Cuisine Soleil received the Food Innovation Award from the Council of Food Manufacturing of Québec (CTAQ) and the Organic Innovator of the Year Award from the Canadian Organic Tade Association (COTA)

partner.name: INL - Nano4Food
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Nano4Food is a R&D Unit working in Nanoencapsulation technologies to functionalize food, packaging solutions for shelf life extension, personalized and printable food, and integrated lab-on-a-chip solutions for food quality, safety and authenticity purposes.

technology.name: Allergy-free eggs
technology.author: tpc
technology.description: The team of investigators is working on modifying the proteins within the egg whites to produce chickens which lay allergy-free eggs. The chicken subsequently born from that egg should in turn lay hypoallergenic eggs.

meta.description: People are valuing what are called superfoods and non-empty calories since they start to make associations of benefic effects by the intake of certain foods. Therefore including superfoods and the right nutrient quantities in prepackaged foods as well as communicating so efficiently may add value for the customer.

partner.name: Syngja
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: BUGS'N SHOT - a series of delicious juice shots with 1% cricket that boost your natural energy in everyday life. Because we are ready to embark on a new chapter of exciting food products that contribute to the personal health, promote vitality & challenge the norms.

partner.name: INL - Nano4Food
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Nano4Food is a R&D Unit working in Nanoencapsulation technologies to functionalize food, packaging solutions for shelf life extension, personalized and printable food, and integrated lab-on-a-chip solutions for food quality, safety and authenticity purposes.

partner.name: Lucky Iron Fish
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Get your daily dose of iron

partner.name: kencko
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Instant fruit and vegetable smoothies, delivered. No need to freeze or blend, just shake it up and go. 100% organic. No added sugar. All the good stuff.

partner.name: Rebbl
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: REBBL was born out of a passionate collaboration between global thought-leaders to identify an innovative solution to uplift vulnerable communities around the world

partner.name: Spirugrow
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Enjoy the freshness of Spirulina and all the benefits of its living nutrients with the first full automated device to grow the algae at home.

partner.name: YUSA
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Yusa is the first drink in the UK to use the guayusa tea leaf to create a healthy refreshing plant-based energy drink that’s high in natural caffeine, antioxidants and low in sugar. We have added only water, plants and fruit juices to create an all-natural alternative energy drink, containing nothing artificial

implementation.name: Vitamin D fortification of milk
implementation.author: man
implementation.description: Functional foods can be considered to be those whole, fortified, enriched or enhanced foods that provide health benefits beyond the provision of essential nutrients (e.g., vitamins and minerals), when they are consumed at efficacious levels as part of a varied diet on a regular basis.

implementation.name: Just bee antioxidant water
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: Supernatural hydration with Just Bee water. Spring water enriched with a single drop of honey, instead of adding refined sugar or artificial sweeteners, making it full of antioxidants.

implementation.name: Moon Cycle Bakery
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: The first hormone-supportive, nutrient-dense sweet treat delivery service empowering women to redefine their time of the month.

implementation.name: Kombucha
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: The Chinese drink that is good for everything.

implementation.name: Spirulina's Summer
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: We wanted to look for a product that was healthier and in partnership with a brand of flour we asked them to adapt a product made from…

technology.name: Diabetic-friendly bread with anthocyanin
technology.author: tpc
technology.description: Scientists at the National University of Singapore have created a bread with anthocyanin, a plant pigment that helps slow digestion, which helps the body keep glucose levels in the blood under control.

technology.name: Allergy-free eggs
technology.author: tpc
technology.description: The team of investigators is working on modifying the proteins within the egg whites to produce chickens which lay allergy-free eggs. The chicken subsequently born from that egg should in turn lay hypoallergenic eggs.

meta.description:
With open borders and the mix of cultures each time more present in a growing number of cities, a need for a comum language and translations arise.
Offering products and services that solve or mitigate nuisances and inconveniences of foreign visitors as well as giving them advantages/benefits  that help make the most of their visits and optimize their experience.

implementation.name: WeSwap
implementation.author: nlg
implementation.description: Founded in 2011, launched in 2015 and now celebrating £130 million in swapped currency. WeSwap lets travelers around the world spend, store, swap, and manage their currency in a completely new way. No hidden costs or unfair fees. The result? More to spend on the important things. Sangria. Bike rides. Emergency sun cream.

implementation.name: Eurowag VAT refund
implementation.author: nlg
implementation.description: Standard refunds allow you to get VAT back for fuel, tolls, repairs, exhibitions and fairs, accommodation, representation, consultancy and legal services at the lowest cost to you.

implementation.name: Alipay's Sydney City Card
implementation.author: nlg
implementation.description: Chinese mobile payments company Alipay and Tourism Australia will pilot a new city service in Sydney to promote leading tourist and retail destinations.

partner.name: menunfc
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Multi-lingual digital menu with allergens, orders and payments.

partner.name: Unbabel
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Delight your customers, build stronger teams, scale your business — with our translation solutions, you can do what you do best, better.

meta.description: Provide tools that ease the collection and reading of traceability information of food and non-food products. Adopting solutions and establishing partnerships that enable a supply-chain-wide traceability will help any company raise consumer trust as well as improving internal accountability.

partner.name: IBM's Food Traceability
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: IBM's Food Trust Ledger allows consumers to discover the whole story of the products, from farm to shelf

partner.name: FoodLogiQ
partner.author: man
partner.description: A food industry software solution that specializes in Supplier Management, Food Safety Compliance, Quality Incident Management, Recall Management, and Whole Chain Traceability.

partner.name: Agroop
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Agroop is developing a Bigdata platform based on a combine software and IoT solution to help farmers to produce more using less resources.

partner.name: Nelson and Pade
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Aquaponic Systems® produce higher quality fish and vegetables with increased production over other systems. The water flowing through the system is nutrient-rich, but clear, providing bio-security and food safety. The plant roots are bright white and clean and the fish are raised in fresh, clear water.

partner.name: arc-net
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: arc-net connects every step of your product's journey to deliver supply chain transparency and product security. The arc-net toolset provides an easy to use scalable platform, powering the strategic insights that unlock profit.

partner.name: Ambrosus
partner.author: aec
partner.description: At the Ambrosus project we aim to radically improve the global supply chains by creating a trusted ecosystem where we can reliably record the entire history of products and execute commercial transactions accordingly. We seek to enable a more secure and autonomous supply chain, improve distribution processes and allow consumers to easily see where their products come from and what is really in them.

partner.name: C2Sense
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: C2Sense’s solution lies in developing sensors that can monitor volatiles directly related to meat/poultry/fish freshness and fruit ripeness at all stages of the supply chain. It is a result from MIT R&D.

partner.name: Big Eye
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: End-to-end transparency through B2B Fish Procurement Powered by the Public Ledger Technology (known as Blockchain), fish buyers can now be automatically notified about their suppliers’ trust level, having artificial intelligence working to ensure fraud-free information and supply chain transparency.

partner.name: Infarm
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Farms inspired by nature’s most elegant design and structures. Each is its own ecosystem that tailor light spectrums, temperature, and nutrients to ensure the maximum natural expression of each plant.

partner.name: farm(x)
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: FarmX sensors measure soil, plant and environmental variables to accurately measure water stress. Advanced predictive algorithms deliver real-time irrigation actions.

partner.name: Iris Monitoring
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Iris monitoring combines IR Spectroscopy and Machine Learning to deliver a set of solutions for food and beverage analysis.

partner.name: KabaQ
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: KabaQ augmented reality food menu enables restaurateurs to present their menu in 3D, providing stunning visualization of their dishes and thus opportunities for upselling.

partner.name: Koalo
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Koalo create ecosystems to grow organic food indoors. Koaloponics combines leading-edge aquaponics research with web-connected tags, sensors and controls to create a smart indoor growing system.

partner.name: INL - Nano4Food
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Nano4Food is a R&D Unit working in Nanoencapsulation technologies to functionalize food, packaging solutions for shelf life extension, personalized and printable food, and integrated lab-on-a-chip solutions for food quality, safety and authenticity purposes.

partner.name: Grow to green
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Plants are grown in a multilayer indoor environment where temperature, humidity, CO2 concentration, lighting conditions and plant nutrition (via a hydroponics system) are not only monitored but also carefully controlled. With this technology, climatic or biological risks are virtually eliminated from normal plant development so you can grow better vegetables all year round.

partner.name: Pentair Aquatic Eco-System
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Shortages of water and energy. Urban food deserts. Pollution of soils and waterways. There’s a clear need for sustainable new sources of nutritious food. Aquaponics is the future. Pentair Aquatic Eco-Systems is committed to the commercialization of systems that create the better water needed to grow healthy fish and plants.

partner.name: Sintef
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: SINTEF (Norway) developed three innovative sensor systems to measure tenderness, water bonding and activity, bacterial contamination, and the detection of foreign bodies in meat products.

partner.name: Tellspec
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Tellspec Food Sensor is able to scan food at a molecular level, identify calories, macronutrients, allergens, and also provide relevant information such as food fraud, food adulteration and food quality.

partner.name: Electronic Tongue
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: The electronic tongue is an innovative technology that can taste food through sensors.  Researchers at Porto University developed a nanosensor that can mimic what happens in our mouth when drinking wine.

partner.name: Firefly Dx real-time PCR pathogen detection system
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: The Firefly Dx real-time PCR pathogen detection system is designed to provide real-time results in a handheld device, cutting out existing systems, which require lab-based equipment and can take hours/days to provide results. It is possible to detect E. coli bacteria in less than 20 minutes.

partner.name: FRCFT
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: UCD Food Refrigeration & Computerised Food Technology (FRCFT) is an internationally recognized center of excellence for food engineering research and education. FRCFT developed a hyperspectral imaging non-destructive method applied to food (e.g. meat, fruits, vegetables, fish) for sample classification and grading, defect and disease detection, distribution visualization of chemical attributes in chemical images, and evaluations of overall quality.

partner.name: WiseCrop
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: WiseCrop collect the data needed for informed decision-making. Agricultural intelligence supports the decisions. It avoids unnecessary trips, allows to react immediately and allows efficient management of the business.

partner.name: Sourcemap
partner.author: aec
partner.description: Technology to achieve 100% traceable, transparent supply chains.

partner.name: Nutrasign
partner.author: aec
partner.description: Do you know where your food comes from? Confidence and transparency from the origin to your hands

partner.name: traace
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: With Traace your products' package starts acting like software and automatically collects data when someone interacts with it using a smartphone, through your brand's online channels.

partner.name: Bulkbox Foods
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Fill your kitchen with beautiful meals starting at $2.90, while knowing you are getting the quality and value of farm to market food that your family deserves.

partner.name: SAP Global Batch Traceability
partner.author: nlg
partner.description: Get real-time insight into batch genealogy with our product traceability software – SAP Global Batch Traceability.

partner.name: smartLOGO
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: smartLOGO, the real alternative to qr-code allows you to engage your consumer with relevant content.

partner.name: UWINLOC
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Tag your assets, reduce your delays, and optimize your stock flow with UWINLOC's innovative indoor location system, a new standard for IoT assets tracking.

implementation.name: Carrefour Fruit Traceability
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: In March Carrefour launched the first European food traceability blockchain for its Quality Line chicken from Auvergne. Last month the supermarket group extended the coverage to Carrefour Quality Line tomatoes.

implementation.name: Japanese Government Sea Cucumber Traceability
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: Blockchain technology – is being picked up in Japan to verify the traceability of high-end sea cucumber.

implementation.name: Vanilla Traceability
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: To complement Ambrosus’ most recent publicly announced partnership with Premium Goods and use-case surrounding the traceability of…

implementation.name: Biggest grocers to use blockchain for food safety, traceability by 2025 – Gartner
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Gartner expects that, by 2025, 20% of the top ten global grocers by revenue will use blockchain for food safety and traceability to create visibility on production, quality and freshness.

implementation.name: Walmart's food safety solution using IBM Food Trust built on the IBM Blockchain Platform
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Walmart & IBM Food Trust: adding trust and transparency to our food

technology.name: Augmented reality for Extended product information
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Additional information about a product is displayed by pointing the camera at the object. The details appear on screen, giving extra information that isn't on the label.
technology.prevwork: BIT did a proof-of-concept of this technology.

technology.name: Hydroponics for In-store greenhouse
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: In-store hydroponics to deliver the freshest products. Plants grow in a water-based environment where the right nutrients in the right amount are distributed through capillary action, without using of soil.
technology.prevwork: A Study is available. An experiement was planned but it was canceled for lack of suitable partners for the envisaged use case.

technology.name: Aquaponics for In-store greenhouse
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: In-store production of greens and fish in a symbiotic environment. Fish share the water tank with bacteria that turn their waste into a rich fertilizer that is then fed to the plants.

technology.name: Internet of things for Smart farming
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: IoT smart farming strategies can be applied to optimize food production and provide traceability. Through smart farming it is possible to increase both the quantity and the quality of agricultural products, as wells as the intelligence of farms. Collecting massive amounts of information, from soil mapping, crop fields, weather data and more, using specialized sensors will help in having a better productivity.

technology.name: Printed electronics for Disposable smart labels
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Labels with embed sensors and/or displays can help to audit the supply chain. Electrochromic displays are printable on plastic or paper to produce smart labels. These displays use almost no power (no recharging or battery replacement). They are low weight, thin, flexible, transparent, yet robust. Can be combined with sensors (e.g. movement, temperature).
technology.prevwork: A study is available. An experiment to trace the temperature of meat supply chain is being envisaged.

technology.name: NFC for Extended product information
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: NFC allows customers to interact and fully engage with products instore. NFC equipped mobile phones allow for the retrieval of information via information beacons, creation of ‘virtual’ sales people or coupons in real time. Customers can check online reviews that help in their purchase.

technology.name: E-paper for Electronic shelf labels
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Replace paper with e-paper based labels to save staff time, improve information accuracy, and speed up pricing strategy deployment. With this tech the images are shown through e-ink, where a group of microcapsules contains tiny black or white spheres that are positioned according to the electric charge driven through the material.
technology.prevwork: An experiment is being conducted by BIT design department.

technology.name: Sensors for Food quality analysis
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Specific low-cost sensors can analyze the quality of food outside labs. Innovative technologies are being developed to analyze the overall quality of food, including their grade of maturation (in the case of fruit), molecular composition, presence of contaminants, and other characteristics.
technology.prevwork: Some devices were experimented in the past but none presented reliable results. Further study must ne done.

technology.name: Blockchain for Food traceability
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Track the origin and process chain of food ingredients to transparently deliver this info to customers. It's a decentralized technology that ensures data integrity adding a cryptography-based signature. When traceability data is added to a blockchain data base, it cannot be repudiated and adulterated by unauthorized entities.
technology.prevwork: A study was conducted in collaboration with Everis showing that there is no need yet to blockchain in our supply chain traceability. The digitalization of these processes have precedence over the introduction of blockchain technology.

meta.description: Information by request is already a reality in a selection of fields. Food past and characteristics seem like a logical next step that may align with the crescendo of worries about the environment and a fairer world.

implementation.name: Food Ethics Council
implementation.author: man
implementation.description: Businesses are presented with ethical choices whenever they decide what to buy and sell, how they source their products, what prices they pay and what prices they charge.

implementation.name: Made by Cow
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: This higher quality milk is bottled straight from the cows within hours and then put under intense isostatic cold-water pressure, compressing both the bottle and the milk inside for several minutes. This pressure eliminates any harmful bacteria, whilst being gentler on milk’s natural nutrients.

partner.name: Repreve
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Recycled bottles are transformed into a fiber, used by the world's leading brands to make athletic and fashion apparel and more. The process embeds properties like wicking, adaptive warming and cooling, water repellency, and more at the fiber level. For reliable, durable quality.

technology.name: Sustainable materials for Textiles
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Promote sustainable materials, manufacturing processes, and/or waste management. More sustainable materials are based on natural fibers from consciences agriculture or by recycled or recyclable synthetic fibers. More sustainable processes consume less resources such as water and produce less waste.
technology.prevwork: A study is available. Na experiment on tableware or homeware to explore some approaches is recommended.

meta.description: Living in a world of personalization means to stop applying the one-size-fits-all model and that in turn implies accepting people and their differences in all environments.

partner.name: menunfc
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Multi-lingual digital menu with allergens, orders and payments.

partner.name: Unbabel
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Delight your customers, build stronger teams, scale your business — with our translation solutions, you can do what you do best, better.

implementation.name: Lincoln hospital to open new multi-faith prayer room
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: A new multi-faith prayer room will open at Lincoln County Hospital this week for patients, visitors and staff.

implementation.name: New multi-faith prayer room opens at Boro's Riverside Stadium
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: A new prayer room has been opened at the Riverside, allowing football fans of all faiths a quiet place for religious observance.

implementation.name: How catering to ethnic populations can spice up shopping and profits
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Winn-Dixie recently opened five Fresco Y Mas branded stores in South Florida, catering to Hispanic communities by offering authentic ingredients this demographic often can’t find in an average chain grocery store.

implementation.name: Fresh foods and flavors: how multicultural consumers are driving fresh grocery trends
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: It’s increasingly imperative for retailers and manufacturers to understand the full force and buying behavior of multicultural Americans who inspire and drive trends at retail. In a recent survey, 32% of all Americans said they would pay more for a brand that understands multicultural needs.

implementation.name: Supermarket quiet hours: creating an inclusive shopping experience for everyone
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: “Quiet hour” is a ground-breaking move by the supermarket giant and what was designed to meet the needs of people on the autistic spectrum has proved to be of immense value to many other people.

meta.description: Include cruelty free products in the assortment. Sourcing this type of producer can by simply scouting those who already have the approach in place, or training producers already partnered into creating this paradigm, ever more present in the consumer's mind.

implementation.name: Geltor Vegan Collagen
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: N-Collage is described by CEW as the first ever animal-free, high-performance collagen for cosmetics. Geltor achieves its product by programming microbes that then produce collagen.

implementation.name: Carrefour Audits
implementation.description: Carrefour will audit meatpacking refrigerators bearing the brand name of the French group and ask them to install cameras in response to growing consumer demand for socially responsible practices.

implementation.name: Tesco Humane Fish Slaughter
implementation.author: aec
implementation.description: Turkey’s largest bass and bream farmer Kilic is currently testing the new slaughtering system developed by Tesco and will kick it off soon for 1,000t of production.

partner.name: Poulehouse egg that doesn't kill the hen
partner.author: man
partner.description: Innovative concept and respectful of all forms of life, Poulehouse offers the first egg that does not kill the chicken with a slaughter-free mode of production.

partner.name: Bee Approved
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Honey is an animal product and therefore, not suitable for vegans. It is produced by bees for themselves and not for human use. Our first product, Bee Approved* looks and tastes like honey but, most importantly, no bees are harmed in its production.

meta.description:
If it's worth a "like", it's worth a visit. The value proposition of a brand is not exclusively inherent to its products or services anymore. The surroundings count.
Design every product and service so that consumers would want to be be seen using them. A good portion of your brand marketing will become self-sufficient.

implementation.name: Museum of Ice Cream
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: In the summer of 2016, ice cream lover Bunn opened her first 45-day pop-up Museum of Ice Cream in New York, featuring art installations and a pool of multicolored plastic sprinkles. An instant hit, it left 200,000 people on the waitlist.

implementation.name: Unicorn Frappuccino mania: Starbucks aims at Instagram
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Coffee chain enhances profile with selfie-friendly Unicorn Frappuccino. It tastes awful, say some – but looks great on social media

implementation.name: The 15 most Instagrammable restaurants in the world
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: These are the spots people would still go for the ‘gram even if all that was served was hardtack.

implementation.name: Why are fancy bathrooms all over Instagram?
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Hotels and restaurants are hoping you’ll take a selfie in one of their novelty bathrooms.

meta.description: While attention to one's health as increased, the role of food as an emotional tool hasn't changed. By creating alternative, healthier indulgences we are allowed some guilt-free "guilty-pleasures". Restaurants like gourmet burger houses and wholewheat pizzas continue to spread, and show no signs of stopping.

implementation.name: Yonest
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: The ingredients in your yogurt are separated until you decide how you want them together. Only in this way is it possible to make the purest yogurt, the freshest flavor and the most delicious creaminess.

implementation.name: Shrimp made from algae
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Shrimp, United States’ most popular seafood, is notorious for being farmed using practices that destroy the environment. New Wave Foods, a startup based in San Francisco, has set out to create a sustainable replacement.

implementation.name: Vegan burgers: now juicy, pink and bloody
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: Supermarkets stock up as millions of UK ‘flexitarians’ boost demand for fake meat

implementation.name: Apy Ball
implementation.author: nlg
implementation.description: Apyball is a young and modern line of simple, authentic and conscious healthy snacks. Made from raw, natural and biological ingredients, gluten-free, without refined sugar and lactose-free. We belong to a new generation that strives for a sustainable, healthy and ecological future.

partner.name: Emulsar
partner.author: tpc
partner.description: Emulsar designs, develops and produces innovative ingredients in the form of emulsions.

partner.name: Farmer's Fridge
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: We make fresh meals in our kitchen and fill our Fridges with wholesome, delicious salads, bowls, snacks and more. Unpurchased items are regularly donated to local food pantries, providing responsibly sourced nutrition to community members in need.

partner.name: No Dough Pizza Co
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Can a pizza be delicious and healthy?! No Dough Pizza Co. is on a mission to do exactly that. With our patented process we have cracked how to make a pizza base out of over 70% cauliflower.

partner.name: Zveetz
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Giving consumers Sugar reduced and plant-based options of their favorite treats.

partner.name: BOL
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: At BOL, we're on a mission to help reverse our negative impact on the planet by inspiring people to eat more plants. These are the promises we make to ensure we set the bar high in our pursuit of sustainable and ethical practices.

technology.name: Structured emulsions and edible oleogels
technology.author: tpc
technology.description: Structured emulsions and edible oleogels are solutions to substitute solid unhealthy fats (e.g. butter) with liquid heathy fats (e.g. linen oil). This enables the production of crumbly meltable food containing fatty acids instead of saturated fats (e.g. chocolate, cookies).
technology.prevwork: An internal study exploring the use of oleogels to replace animal fat with linen oil in sausages or hamburgers concluded that this application is not economically viable. Other applications in sauces, chocolate or cookies have still not been explored.

technology.name: Nanotechnologically engineered wine
technology.author: tpc
technology.description: Tasteless liquids contain nano-capsules that are activated by microwave transmitters. After activation, the capsules release the chemicals that will give flavor, appearance and nutritional composition to the liquid.

meta.description: With the war on plastic coming to its peak, it's more relevant than ever to rethink the way we shop and, most importantly, the way we sell. More and more consumers are craving for the opportunity to reuse their personal containers in order to help saving the planet.

implementation.name: Drinkfinity
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: With Drinkfinity, people can "Peel, Pop and Shake" to combine the dry and liquid ingredients contained in portable pods with water in a specially designed, reusable, BPA-free vessel, and create beverage blends in a variety of flavors, the company says.

implementation.name: Loop’s launch brings reusable packaging to the world’s biggest brands
implementation.author: man
implementation.description: Loop has gathered the world's biggest brands, all of which are piloting a new system of high-quality packaging that can be returned and refilled again and again. In essence, it changes the ownership model of packaging from consumer to producer.

implementation.name: Reusable Container Program
implementation.author: tpc
implementation.description: The Bulk Nation USA launched a program to encourage customers to bring their own containers to be filled with the products being sold in bulk at their stores. Hygiene and food safety concerns are covered in the program as well as the process to tare the containers before filling.

implementation.name: Why sustainable products are a win-win for all of us
implementation.author: jgp
implementation.description: The company must simply be motivated by better profits, more growth, increased employee engagement and making the world a better place. It seems like an easy choice.

partner.name:
Splosh Refilling is
easier than Recycling
partner.author: man
partner.description: Splosh delivers your refills at home after having received the initial full bottles.

partner.name: Loop's Reusable Packaging
partner.author: man
partner.description: Durable design allows our product partners to completely reinvent what packaging and products should look and feel like, and even what they can do. While disposable design focuses on making our packaging as cheap as possible, durable design focuses on making containers as long lasting as possible, allowing us to access unparalleled materials, design, and function.

partner.name: 24 Bottles
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: 24Bottles is the Italian design brand born in 2013 with the mission of unburdening the planet from disposable plastic bottles, providing a wide range of carefully designed, high-quality, easy-to-carry, sustainable stainless-steel bottles for daily hydration on the go.

partner.name: dropwater
partner.author: jgp
partner.description: Drop Water is reinventing how bottled water is made and distributed. Our kiosks bottle drinks at the point of purchase in 100% compostable bottles.

technology.name: Bio-plastics
technology.author: radar18
technology.description: Bio-materials provide special characteristics to plastics. Innovative advanced materials are continuously in development. Those materials are derived from renewable biomass sources, such as vegetable fats and oils, corn starch, or microbiota. Most of bioplastics are biodegradable, which that under the right conditions the microbes in the environment can break down the material and use it as a food source.
technology.prevwork: A study is available with a list of technologies that can be used. Further study about the most disruptive technologies is still missing.
